DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to investigate whether reduced subcutaneous dissection area could offer patients more clinical benefits.
DOC.brief_title: Impact of Dissection Area on the Clinical Outcome of Endoscopic Thyroidectomy
DOC.detailed_description: To create a working place in the chest wall is an inevitable step of endoscopic thyroidectomy. Large subcutaneous area was considered a drawback of endoscopic thyroidectomy. The purpose of this study is to investigate whether subcutaneous dissection area has influence on clinical outcome of endoscopic thyroidectomy, such as post-operative pain, complication rate and post-operative discomfort.
DOC.criteria: thyroid nodule diagnosed by ultrasound willing to undergo endoscopic thyroidectomy conversion to open surgery unwilling to join the research
